edu.umn.nlpnewt

Class Newt

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umn.nlpnewt.Newt

  • public final class Newt
extends java.lang.Object
    The main class and entry points for the NLP-NEWT framework.

    This object provides methods for interacting with a newt events service and for launching newt processors written in Java.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String EVENTS_SERVICE_NAME
      The name used by the events service for discovery.
      static java.lang.String PROCESSOR_SERVICE_TAG
      The name used by the processor services for discovery.

      • standardLabelIndex

        @NotNull
public static <L extends Label> @NotNull LabelIndex<L> standardLabelIndex(@NotNull
                                                                                   @NotNull java.util.List<L> labels)
        Creates a standard (capable of handling overlapping labels) label index.
        Type Parameters:
        L - The label type.
        Parameters:
        labels - Label objects to use to create the label index.
        Returns:
        Label Index object.

      • distinctLabelIndex

        @NotNull
public static <L extends Label> @NotNull LabelIndex<L> distinctLabelIndex(@NotNull
                                                                                   @NotNull java.util.List<L> labels)
        Creates a distinct (not capable of handling overlapping labels) label index.

        The technical definition of distinctness is that all labels should be able to be ordered such that start indices and end indices are strictly increasing.

        Type Parameters:
        L - The label type.
        Parameters:
        labels - Label objects to use to create the label index.
        Returns:
        Label Index object.

      • events

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Events events(@Nullable
                                       @Nullable java.lang.String address)
        Creates an object for interacting with a newt events service. 
           
   try (Events events = newt.events("localhost:9090")) {
     // interact with events service.
   }
        Parameters:
        address - The bound address and port of a newt events service. For example: "localhost:9090" or null if service discovery should be used.
        Returns:
        Events object connected to the events service.

      • events

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Events events(@NotNull
                                       @NotNull java.lang.String host,
                                       int port)
        Creates an object for interacting with a newt events service. 
           
   try (Events events = newt.events("localhost", 9090)) {
     // interact with the events service.
   }
        Parameters:
        host - The host ip or name of a newt events service. Example: "localhost" or "1.1.1.1".
        port - The host port of a newt events service. Example: 9999.
        Returns:
        Events object connected to the events service.

      • events

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Events events(@NotNull
                                       @NotNull java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
        Creates an object for interacting with a newt events service. 
           
   InetSocketAddress address = new InetSocketAddress("localhost", 9090);
   try (Events events = newt.events(address)) {
     // interact with events service.
   }
        Parameters:
        address - An InetSocketAddress for the bound address and port of a newt events service.
        Returns:
        Events object connected to the events service.

      • createProcessorServer

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Server createProcessorServer(@NotNull
                                                      @NotNull ProcessorServerOptions options)
                                               throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a Server object that can be used to start hosting an EventProcessor or an DocumentProcessorBase.

        Example: 

           
   ProcessorServerOptions options = ProcessorServerOptions.emptyOptions()
       .emptyOptions()
       .withProcessor(new SomeProcessor())
       .withPort(9090)
       .register();
   Server server = newt.getProcessorServer(options);
   server.start();
        Parameters:
        options - The options object.
        Returns:
        Server object that can be used to start and shutdown serving the processor.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
